arm_group.description: This group consisted of age matched non-pregnant healthy volunteers
This group consisted of age matched healthy pregnant  volunteers

biospec_descr.textblock: no biospecimens are to be retained

brief_summary.textblock:
Gestational diabetes mellitus (GDM) is a risk factor for the development of type II diabetes
      and it is responsible for the morbidity of both mother and child. The aim of this study was
      to determine retinal findings of gestational diabetes mellitus (GDM).

clinical_study.brief_title: EVALUATION OF THE MACULAR, PERIPAPILLARY NERVE FIBER LAYER AND CHOROID THICKNESS CHANGES IN THE GESTATIONAL DIABETES MELLITUS, HEALTHY PREGNANT AND WOMEN VOLUNTEERS.
clinical_study.condition: Retinal Evaluation in Patients With GDM.

detailed_description.textblock:
We have three groups; the first group consisted of pregnant volunteers with GDM. The second
      group consisted of healthy pregnant participants. The third group consisted of healthy,
      non-pregnant women at the reproductive age. Macular, choroid and retinal nerve fiber layer
      (RNFL) thicknesses were evaluated in patients with GDM and comparisons were made among GDM,
      healthy pregnant and healthy non-pregnant subjects for these parameters by using optic
      cohorence tomography.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

        Singleton pregnancies Pregnancies between 26-28 weeks of gestation Gestational Diabetes

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  ocular surgery ocular trauma glaucoma cystoid macular edema macular degeneration
             optic atrophy

clinical_study.keyword: gestational diabetes mellitus; optical coherence tomography; pregnancy; retinal nerve fiber layer.
clinical_study.official_title: EVALUATION OF THE MACULAR, PERIPAPILLARY NERVE FIBER LAYER AND CHOROID THICKNESS CHANGES IN THE GESTATIONAL DIABETES MELLITUS, HEALTHY PREGNANT AND WOMEN VOLUNTEERS.

primary_outcome.description: The aim of this study was to determine retinal findings of gestational diabetes mellitus (GDM).

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Crossover, Time Perspective: Prospective
